Target: OntoDevice is an ontology for describing devices, their capabilities and properties.

Comment: An object designed and manufactured to perform one or more functions.
Label: Device

Comment: A sensor is a device that detects and responds to some type of input from the physical environment.
Label: Sensor

Comment: A microcontroller is an integrated circuit (IC) designed to handle a specific task in embedded systems.
Label: MicroController

Comment: An electrical/mechanical machine that accomplish some household functions, such as cleaning or cooking.
Label: Appliance

Comment: A device built to accurately detect and display a quantity in a form readable by a human being.
Label: Meter

Comment: A portable telephone that can make and receive calls over a radio frequency link.
Label: Mobile phone

Comment: A transducer that converts sound into an electrical signal.
Label: Microphone

Comment: An optical instrument that can capture an image.
Label: Camera

Comment: A device, either on land or sea, with instruments and equipment for measuring atmospheric conditions to provide information for weather forecasts and to study the weather and climate.
Label: Weather station

Comment: A tag that uses a form of electronic identification technology (Bluetooth, RFID etc).
Label: Electronic tag

Comment: A device that measures magnetic field or magnetic dipole moment.
Label: Magnetometer

Comment: A tool that measures proper acceleration.
Label: Accelerometer

Comment: A device that measures the amount of electric energy consumed by a residence, a business, or an electrically powered device.
Label: Electrical meter

Comment: A device that measure and communicate water usage from consumer to provider to facilitate water management and proper billing.
Label: Water meter

Comment: A device for measuring air quality.
Label: Pollution meter

Comment: A device for measuring the flow of oil.
Label: Oil meter

Comment: A device that is composed of one or more Sensors together with a MicroController.
Label: Smart sensor

Comment: A sensor that is able to measure the level of illuminance.
Label: Illuminance sensor

Comment: A sensor that is able to measure the concentration of carbon dioxide gas in the atmosphere.
Label: CO2 sensor

Comment: A sensor that is able to measure the level of humidity in the atmosphere.
Label: Humidity sensor

Comment: A sensor that is able to measure hotness and coolness and converts it into an electrical signal.
Label: Temperature sensor

Comment: A sensor used to gather information from an RFID tag, which is used to track individual objects.
Label: RFID sensor

Comment: A sensor that detect minute localized changes in the force of Earth’s gravity caused by variations in rock or other materials’ density underground.
Label: Gravity sensor

Comment: A GPS Sensor or Receiver is a device used within Earth’s planetary atmosphere to determine its precise geographical location.
Label: GPS sensor

Comment: A portable computer device that combines mobile telephone and computing functions into one unit.
Label: Smart phone

Comment: A device that is usually used for the preservation of items like food via temperature regulation.
Label: Fridge

Comment: An electronic tag that exchanges data with a RFID reader through radio waves.
Label: RFID tag

Comment: A passive RFID tag that functions via the electromagnetic energy that gets transmitted from the RFID reader.
Label: Passive RFID tag

Comment: An active RFID tag that requires batteries for operation.
Label: Active RFID tag

Comment: Survival Range describes Survival Properties of a device under some specified conditions.
Label: Survival range

Comment: Operating Range describes normal Operating Properties of a device under some specified conditions.
Label: Operating range

Comment: System Capability describes normal measurement, actuation, sampling properties such as accuracy, range, precision, etc. of a System under some specified Conditions such as a temperature range.
Label: System capability

Comment: A System Property is an identifiable and observable characteristic that represents the System's ability to operate its primary purpose.
Label: System property

Comment: Accuracy is the maximum difference that will exist between the actual value (which must be measured by a primary or good secondary standard) and the indicated value at the output of a measurement device (e.g. sensor).
Label: Accuracy

Comment: Measurement range is the range that a measurement device can perform measurement.
Label: Measurement range

Comment: Precision is the degree of reproducibility of a measurement.
Label: Precision

Comment: Resolution is the smallest detectable incremental change of input parameter that can be detected in the output signal.
Label: Resolution

Comment: Sensitivity is the minimum input of physical parameter that will create a detectable output change.
Label: Sensitivity

Comment: Sampling Frequency is the number of samples that a measurement device can produce per second .
Label: Sampling frequency

Comment: Conditions that affects the properties of a device and its operations.
Label: Condition

Comment: Operating Property is an identifiable characteristic that represents how the device operates under the specified Conditions.
Label: Operating property

Comment: The value of a quality that is non-numerical and can be observed but not measured.
Label: Qualitative value

Comment: A Quality refers to the characteristic or feature of something (Colour, Status etc).
Label: Quality

Comment: The current state or situation of something.
Label: Status

Comment: The current state of something on whether it is inside or outside of something else like a location.
Label: In out status

Comment: The current state of something on whether it is turned on or off at the moment.
Label: On off status

Comment: The ratio of working power, measured in kilowatts (kW), to apparent power, measured in kilovolt amperes (kVA).
Label: Power factor

Comment: A relationship between a device and the quality it is observing.
Label: observes

Comment: A relationship between a quality and the device that is observing it.
Label: is observed by

Comment: A relationship between a device and a quantity that it is measuring.
Label: measures

Comment: A relationship between a device and a quantity that it is measuring.
Label: measures

Comment: A relationship between a quantity and the device that is measuring it.
Label: is measured by

Comment: A relationship between a quantity and the device that is measuring it.
Label: is measured by

Comment: A relationship between a device and its length.
Label: has length

Comment: A relationship between a device and its height.
Label: has height

Comment: A relationship between a device and its width.
Label: has width

Comment: A relationship between a device and its price.
Label: has price

Comment: A relationship between a device and its mass.
Label: has mass

Comment: A relationship between a device and its system capability.
Label: has system capability

Comment: A relationship between a device and its operating range.
Label: has operating range

Comment: A relationship between a device and its survival range.
Label: has survival range

Comment: A relationship that describes the prevailing environmental Conditions for system capabilites, operating ranges and survival ranges.
Label: in condition

Comment: A relationship that describes the prevailing environmental Conditions for system capabilites, operating ranges and survival ranges.
Label: in condition

Comment: A relationship that describes the prevailing environmental Conditions for system capabilites, operating ranges and survival ranges.
Label: in condition

Comment: A relationship between the operating range of a device to an operating property.
Label: has operating property

Comment: A relationship between the system capability of a device to a system property.
Label: has system property

Comment: A relationship between a device and its properties (some quantity or quality).
Label: has property

Comment: A relationship between a device and its properties (some quantity or quality).
Label: has property

Comment: A relationship between a property (some quantity or quality) and the device that the property belongs to.
Label: is property of

Comment: A relationship between a property (some quantity or quality) and the device that the property belongs to.
Label: is property of

Comment: A relationship between a quality and its value.
Label: has qualitative value

Comment: A relationship that describes a device being attached to another device where the attached device’s operation is not affected by the device it is attached to and vice versa.
Label: is attached to

Comment: A relationship that describes a device being connected to another device where the operation of one device will affect the other.
Label: is connected to
